tfnbs.datasets¶

tfnbs.datasets.generate_fc_matrices(N, effect_size, mask=None, n_samples_group1=50, n_samples_group2=50, repeated_measures=False, seed=None)[source]¶

Generate synthetic functional connectivity correlation matrices for groupwise comparisons or repeated measures.

Parameters:

  • N (int) – Number of ROIs (regions of interest) i.e. an N*N matrix.

  • effect_size (float) – Magnitude of correlation difference between groups.

  • mask (np.ndarray, optional) – Binary mask (N*N) matrix to apply correlation differences.

  • n_samples_group1 (int) – Number of matrices in group 1 (default: 50).

  • n_samples_group2 (int) – Number of matrices in group 2 (default: 50).

  • repeated_measures (bool) – If True, generate within-subject repeated measures data i.e. Paired else independently (default = False).

  • seed (int, optional) – Random seed for reproducibility.

Returns:

Array of with functional connectivity matrics of group1 as (n_samples_group1, N, N). group2 (np.ndarray): Array of with functional connectivity matrics of group2 as (n_samples_group2, N, N). (base_cov, mod_cov): Original Covariance matrix and Modified covariance matrix with effect_size introduced

for group1 and group2 matrices.

Return type:

group1 (np.ndarray)

>>> N = 6; e = 0.2; mask = np.zeros((N, N))
>>> mask[0:2, 0:2] = 1; mask[2:4, 2:4] = -1
>>> g1, g2, (c1,c2) = generate_fc_matrices(N, e, mask, 5, 10, seed = 0)
>>> g1.shape == (5, 6, 6)
True
>>> g2.shape == (10, 6, 6)
True
>>> np.allclose(c1,c1.T)
True
